title.narrative: SMA quality assurance support to DGMM

description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att främja ett rättighetsbaserat system för internationellt skydd av flyktingar. Migrationsverket kommer att stödja DGMM: (1) i att introducera ett kvalitetssäkringssystem för att bestämma flyktingars status utifån ett vedertaget uniformt system; (2) i att bli en mer förutsägbar och transparent organsiation; samt, (3) i att säkerställa att utsatta asylsökande och migranters rättigheter skyddas, särskilt när det gäller kvinnor och flickor, minderåriga, samt HBTQ-personer. Migrationsverket kommer att stödja institutionell kapacitet och standard inom DGMM, så att de på ett adekvat sätt kan planera migrationshanteringen och samtidigt säkerställa effektiva och rättvisa hanteringsprocedurer.

The Swedish Migration Agency has applied to Sida for funding of 7 000 000 SEK to carry out the project entitled "SMA Quality Assurance Support to DGMM" during the period 2017-2020. The project aims supports the DGMM to promote a rights-based approach to international protection. The SMA will assist the DGMM to: (1) introduce a refugee status determination quality assurance system that promotes uniform and correct decisions; (2) operate in a more transparent, predictable and credible manner, and; (3) protect the rights of vulnerable asylum-seekers and migrants with specific needs, specifically as concerns women and girls, minors, and LGBTI+ persons. The Swedish Migration Agency (SMA), will support the DGMM in the creation of the institutional means and standards that will enable it to adequately plan their migration management policy and ensure efficient and fair procedures for migrants.. The intervention's total budget is 7 000 000 SEK.

The impact goal is for Turkey to discharge fully of its international obligations under international and regional human rights and refugee law insofar as concerns applicants for international protection.

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

tag.narrative: 1.b - Create sound policy frameworks at the national, regional and international levels, based on pro-poor and gender-sensitive development strategies, to support accelerated investment in poverty eradication actions.

1.b - Upprätta sunda policyramverk på nationell, regional och internationell nivå på grundval av utvecklingsstrategier som stödjer de fattiga och tar hänsyn till jämställdhetsaspekter, för att stödja ökade investeringar i åtgärder för att avskaffa fattigdom.
10.7 - Facilitate orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility of people, including through the implementation of planned and well-managed migration policies.
10.7 - Underlätta en ordnad, säker, reglerad och ansvarsfull migration och rörlighet av personer, inklusive genom planerad och väl fungerande migrationspolitik.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Objective 1: Promote an asylum examination process of high-legal quality characterized by uniformity of outcome and procedure While standardized methods for the adjudication and review of claims for international protection at the individual, unit and regional levels were developed the applicants did not benefit from this as foreseen as the asylum examination process the Swedish model was not adopted. Legal directives issued to promote compliance with legal framework was developed and case-based learning was introduced but no implication to whether this added to the legal quality of asylum decisions improvement as stated the a two-tier adjudication model was not adopted. Objective 2: Promote a transparent, predictable and credible asylum examination process A civil society reference group could not be established established and operational Translations on documents were made but the output was cancelled by the DGMM before a Turkish standard was developed for asylum decisions to be drafted in a clear, concise manner using plain language Objective 3: Promote and protect the rights of clients with diverse needs A series of trainings for DGMM staff have been held on LGBTI+ and GBV. But the focal system was cancelled by DGMM. A Plan of Action is developed to meet the needs of survivors and women and girls at risk of GBV Objective 4: Bilateral relations between the DGMM and SMA is strengthened through cross-learning and technical support Training on migration analysis but no indication of how DGMM’s capacity to predict and monitor flight routes and volumes was improved
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
